Summary: My fiance are not the type of people who care about the cosmetic stuff about hotel/motel rooms. But it was pretty bad. The outside of the motel looked decent. Until we got to our room door and had seen a big huge footprint on it. Once we opened the door, things got worse. We had seen a big huge stain on thr floor and we all know that stains happen but it was pretty bad. The rooms paint was chipping off. And then we looked in the bathroom. It was horrible. The toilet had stains on it and the curtian for the shower had red stains on it as well as the shower itself. No wifi which we didn't care about. It tooks us about 30 min to figure out what we wanted to do. We just didn't feel safe in the room. You can hear the people next to us talking really loud. If anyone had ever seen that

Summary Heading: Straight out of a horror movie!
Summary: I will never stay here again! Check-in: -the woman at the desk told us they didn't have our reservation and we were at the wrong motel (we should have just left right then). -my husband showed her the confirmation e-mail and she still told us we were in the wrong place (even though the motel's address was right there in black and white). -after checking again she was able to find our reservation.  The Room: -smelled like cigarettes -dirty carpet -stains on the ceiling -paint peeling from walls -doors to adjoining room had no door knobs and were lined with painters tape -a/c didn't work. the room was warm and stuffy almost the entire time. -long hairs found throughout -desk drawer was missing  The Bathroom: -smelled like urine -no light fixtures, just light bulbs sticking out of

The clerk was friendly and helpful.  The room itself was less than average.  One of the threadbare towels had a black stain on it. An advantage of the hotel was that it was close to Disneyland and, as we didn't spend much time in the room, It worked out okay.

We stayed for 2 nights while our house was being worked on. The office was super friendly, the rooms were nice, the beds are really nice. It had direct tv and free wifi. I would recommend this motel to anyone. And the prices were really good! Cheaper than Motel 6.

I was in town with my family for a funeral and needed some where to stay. I called around and came upon Polynesian Motel and called to check availability. They only had a two bed smoking room left and I needed non smoking the clerk said he would save the room for me. When I arrived, he said I can check it out before I paid. He commented that he went in the room after I called and it smelled fine and there was no stench of smoke....he was right. The room was average but the service was GREAT

Looking for two rooms at a basic & inexpensive motel for a one-night stay near Disneyland, we selected the Polynesian from internet listings.   Upon arrival we discovered it was indeed basic and (relatively) inexpensive, with an emphasis on the “basic”.  After initially considering clicking "poor" I instead rated it "average" based on the price-to-value ratio.  The Polynesian is an older single-story bungalow style motel with rooms that were clean and appeared to have been rehabilitated at a fairly recent date.  Plumbing was all in order, the A/C unit worked properly and the beds were adequately comfortable.  Although located on a major street, it was quiet overnight.  As noted, this is definitely a “basic” motel.  The rooms had TV and refrigerators and there is a soft-drink

BEWARE they have BED BUGGGGGSSSS!!!!! We were on our family vaction we stayed here our last night and at first we thought the rooms were ok just for us to sleep since we were leaving in the morning.The rooms didnt have a clock, the ac was old but worked had a old refrigarator,no microwave, the shower had no room to move.We got back to the room around 11 to sleep around 430am my sister calls me to tell me LETS GO THEY HAVE BEDBUGGS HERE!!!! We jumped out of bed got the kids up and i ckecked the kids bed and sure enough i found a bed bug! I went next door to my sisters room to c and they had about 3/4 bed buggs on the bed that they had killed,my sister called the office they didnt answer,we went to the office the guy came to the window we asked hem to come to the room and see the

my kids were disappointed that the pool was not available  to use...  they said it was being worked on..  we never saw anyone working on it..  i liked that we had a fridge in the room..  but the shower sucked..  no room to move around.  the price was a little high for what you got..

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on a tight budget
Summary: We were looking for a place to spend the night and came across this place online. With only 1 review I was kind of unsure. We were in town for only 1 night because we wanted to spend at least 1 day visiting Disneyland. The motel is about 5-10mins away[depends on traffic]. The room is kind of old but it was clean. I only paid $58 for a night so I wasn't expecting much as far as 5star goes. There was a little fridge in there,but no microwave. The a/c worked fine. It was one of those wall units. There were cleans towels,sheets and cable tv. Quiet at night and a nice pool to enjoy. There were no insects or bedbugs from what I could see. The only problem I had at this place was the bed was a bit firm for me but other than that it was okay. You can park right in front of your room

We stayed on March 10th and 11th.  The room was very clean and spacious.  The room had a good size fridge.  The manager was very friendly with excellent service.  Anytime we needed towels he was on it.  The pool was clean and a nice place to relax at.
